subanswer.text: Simplifying the denominator results in $2^2 \cdot 5^7 = (2*5)^7= 10^7$. So now our expression becomes \[\frac{21}{10^7}\]. The answer is $\frac{21}{10^7}$.

ost_step.1: Multiplying both numerator and denominator by ${10}^{7}$, we get \[(\frac{21}{1}) (\frac{1}{10})^7 =\frac{21}{10^{7}}.\]
ost_step.2: By definition, any fraction whose denominator contains no prime other than 2 or 5 represents a terminating decimal; so \[\frac{21}{10^{7}}\text{ is a terminating decimal.} \]In conclusion, $$\frac{21}{2^2\cdot 5^7}=0.00000021.$$
